content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}
Confidence: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating your confidence level in the action. A higher value means greater confidence.}
Completion: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating how much of the task has been completed until now. Zero means no progress has been made and one means full completion.}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}

Now given a task: Identify the most starred JavaScript repositories on GitHub that were created after 2023-12-29.  Please interact with https://github.com/ and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: To identify the most starred JavaScript repositories created after 2023-12-29, I need to use GitHub's search functionality. The search bar/button is labeled [10] "Search or jump to...". I should click it to access the search functionality or textbox.

Action: Click [10]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.1
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The search input box [3] is now visible and ready for text input. To find the most starred JavaScript repositories created after 2023-12-29, I should use GitHub's advanced search syntax. The appropriate query is: 
language:JavaScript stars:>0 created:>2023-12-29 
This will find recently created JavaScript repos with at least 1 star, and I can sort by stars later if possible.

Action: Type [3]; language:JavaScript stars:>0 created:>2023-12-29
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.3
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The search results are displaying JavaScript repositories created after 2023-12-29, but they are currently sorted by "Best match". To identify the "most starred" repositories, I need to change the sorting to "Most stars." There is a "Sort by: Best match" button labeled [26] which likely allows changing the sorting criteria.

Action: Click [26]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.6
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The sorting dropdown is open, revealing options including "Most stars" [41], which is what I need to select to see the most starred repositories at the top.

Action: Click [41]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.8
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The page is showing an "Error 429," which means too many requests were made in a short period. The query cannot proceed further on GitHub at the moment due to rate limiting.
Action: Google
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.8
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I am on the Google search homepage. To proceed, I should enter a query in the search box to find the most starred JavaScript GitHub repositories created after 2023-12-29.
Action: Type [6]; most starred javascript github repositories created after 2023-12-29
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.85
token: : Type [6]; most starred javascript github repositories created after 2023-12-29

content: Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Google has triggered a reCAPTCHA due to unusual traffic and is blocking further progress until the CAPTCHA is solved. I cannot proceed with collecting search results at this time.

Action: Wait
Confidence: 0.7
Completion: 0.85
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The page is still blocked by a reCAPTCHA with the "I'm not a robot" checkbox visible. Progress is halted since I cannot solve CAPTCHAs.
Action: GoBack
Confidence: 0.8
Completion: 0.85
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I am back on the main Google search page. To proceed, I should try the search again for the most starred JavaScript GitHub repositories created after 2023-12-29 using the search box available at [6].

Action: Type [6]; most starred javascript github repositories created after 2023-12-29
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.85
token: : Type [6]; most starred javascript github repositories created after 2023-12-29

content: Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The reCAPTCHA barrier persists, and Google search is still blocked by "I'm not a robot" challenge. Cannot proceed further with web or Google search for the required information.

Action: GoBack
Confidence: 0.8
Completion: 0.85

content.text:
Observation: please analyze the attached screenshot and give the Thought and Action. I've provided the tag name of each element and the text it contains (if text exists). Note that <textarea> or <input> may be textbox, but not exactly. Please focus more on the screenshot and then refer to the textual information.

content:
Thought: I am back at the main Google search page. Previous searches have triggered reCAPTCHA, so using the same search might result in another block. However, nothing indicates an alternative at this point, and the search task remains.

Action: Type [6]; most starred javascript github repositories created after 2023-12-29
Confidence: 0.85
Completion: 0.85
token: : Type [6]; most starred javascript github repositories created after 2023-12-29

content.text:
Observation: please analyze the attached screenshot and give the Thought and Action. I've provided the tag name of each element and the text it contains (if text exists). Note that <textarea> or <input> may be textbox, but not exactly. Please focus more on the screenshot and then refer to the textual information.
[1]: "Why did this happen?";

content:
Thought: The Google search result is again blocked by the "I'm not a robot" reCAPTCHA, preventing access to any search results. There’s no way to bypass this screen to continue the search.

Action: GoBack
Confidence: 0.85
Completion: 0.85

Note that <textarea> or <input> may be textbox, but not exactly. Please focus more on the screenshot and then refer to the textual information.
[0]: "About";	[1]: "Store";	[2]: "Gmail", "Gmail ";	[3]: "Images", "Search for Images ";	[5]: "Sign in";	[6]: <textarea> "Search";	[13]: "Français";	[14]: "Advertising";	[15]: "Business";	[16]: "How Search works";	[17]: "Privacy";	[18]: "Terms";	[19]: "Settings";	[20]: "Stay signed out";	[21]: "Sign in";

content:
Thought: I am still on the Google search home page. Both previous attempts to search led to reCAPTCHA blocks. Without Google search working, and with GitHub previously rate-limited, there is currently no available web path to answer the task directly.

Action: ANSWER; Unable to identify the most starred JavaScript repositories on GitHub created after 2023-12-29 due to recurring Google reCAPTCHA blocks and GitHub rate-limiting, which prevent access to the required information.
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 1.0
token: : ANSWER; Unable to identify the most starred JavaScript repositories on GitHub created after 2023-12-29 due to recurring Google reCAPTCHA blocks and GitHub rate-limiting, which prevent access to the required information
